Милая история про двух девочек, одна из которых прогуливала, а вторая ругала её за это и пыталась заставить учиться, а потом каким-то неведомым образом это переросло в любовь. В целом, ничего особенного, просто приятная обыденная история, каких полным-полно в школьных аниме. Игра понравилась, ачивки проще простого, но ничего поразительного в ней нет.

38938301.review:
The story is about a yuri couple who reflect on their past and - as the title of this game says - remember how they met.

While the CGs and the music are nice, the story is somewhat dragging on during mid of the game.
There is also a lack of strong emotional conveying to the player, lacking the intensity other VNs deliver.
A strong positive point is the very good voice acting, which is however underutilized due to the mediocre story and missing of more serious scenes.

However, overall still a nice kinetic VN to spend some spare time on - playthrough time is around 3 hours.

Definitely recommended when on sale, but not on full prince - there are much better options here on steam.
Check out e.g. Eden* or Clannad if you look for something serious to read.

38807211.review:
Must-have for followers of the SonoHana series and other fans of this genre.

+ short and sweet plot (don't expect anything revolutionary it's really just sweet shit all the way) that, unfortunately, lasts only 3 hours at most
+ I have to mention twice that it's sweet and cute
+ characters look like they're from a happy little Madoka AU
+ thoughts are still in white text when scrolling back to them (unlike in the other games where the text becomes gray)
+ voice-acting is as good as always
+ art is also as good as always (especially the last CG!)
+ nostalgic returning BGM (I feel for that slow fade in of Spring Breeze as I run the game), even though some of them have slightly different titles from the non-official translations, and a good new ending song

~ (where are all the other SonoHana games)
~ As a cheapskate, I'm leaning towards thinking this was overpriced but maybe it's just me. Independent EN patches of the game have been removed from the internet in hopes of having all other games sold officially for English players. If paying will help with that, I no longer have any objections, but then it doesn't seem to be what's happening.
~ the references to characters from the previous games are fun Easter eggs

- all the other games already had minimal gameplay (4-5 obvious choices per game) but this one had absolutely none
- it feels weird playing a SonoHana game without skipping H scenes. Instead, add an option whether to include them or not (though I do recognize that the 16th game addressed that but it's not like its EN version is the one being sold here)
- the game felt lacking because it didn't show them getting together (so it doesn't feel like an actual conclusion) but I realize that that happens in another, PREVIOUS game which wasn't released in English. Still, the feeling of being lost is there.
- unfortunately, it didn't have a memorable moment that made me swoon, unlike all the other games. Even Takako and Runa's games had one, even if they were relatively the dullest (and most morally questionable) couple in the series

38768999.review:
A short but sweet story that follows two girls recounting how they met. Overall, I wouldn't say it's anything special, but it certainly did a good job at what it was trying to be. There were very few issues I had with the game, but at the same time, I wasn't blown away by anything either. The novel is kinetic, which I don't like. But unlike other kinetic VN's (like eden*) I didn't feel like this subtracted a lot from the experience. Still, a good VN, and I'm happy I played it.

My breakdown:

PROS:
+Voice Acting. Nerine Akimoto (Miya), and Kuroi Neko (Risa) did absolutely superb work with their roles. Not one mistake as far as I could tell, and they nailed their characters flawlessly. Definitely the strongest element of this VN.
+Art style. Apart from a few issues with character design, the game is really solid with its art. Some great CGs.
+Heartfelt story. Story is quite beautiful. There isn't much to it, but what they do is quite wholesome and heartwarming. 

CONS:
-Soundtrack. I thought the soundtrack was rather weak. It wasn't awful, but it wasn't good either. Some scenes would have really benefitted from a stronger OST.
-Short. For the price, the game is really short. I normally consider $1 an hour to be reasonable. You could get through the game in 3 hours without much effort, making it not worth the $8 tag it has. Definitely something you want to pick up on sale.
-Some odd design. Miya's name is orange for some reason. The opening scene was really difficult to follow because of this, as I couldn't tell who was Miya and who was Risa for a bit. Name colour should always be the same as hair colour, or a hair accessory imo. Unamed character names were odd too. They reused "girl A" (or girl 1. I forgot which one they used) for three different characters. Three WILDLY different characters I should add. They shouldn't have reused the same name like that. But I guess I'm nitpicking a bit here.

-Scores-
Story: 6
Characters: 6
Art: 6
Music: 4
Enjoyment: 6

Overall: 6/10

tl;dr short and sweet kinetic novel. Pick it up on sale if it interests you.

The voice acting is okay, it's best point is that it doesn't take anything away from the story.

Will you miss out a lot by not playing this game? Nah. But if you like visual novels and you like yuri, it's worth a shot.

First off, this is a good game IF you don't mind Yuri, and NO player interaction, you don't make a single choice in this game.

Risa and Miya's chemistry is very good, and reading their little adventures was fun, to top it off, everything looks amazing, the CG's are very easy on the eyes, and so are the character models.

If you couldn't guess, this game focuses entirely on these two girls, no other characters.
There really Isn't too much to talk about as this is very very short, and as such, do not pay full price for this game, wait for it to be on sale.
+
Very pretty art
Character chemistry is great
Great looking CGs
Short, if you're looking for a good small little vn.
-
Short, if you're looking for something with more, very costly for the amount
Music felt out of place and there wasn't enough variety, just turn it off
No choices are made, up to you if that's good or bad
Overall, I'd give this a 7.5/10, it is very good and enjoyable, but very short, and ends in such a way that there clearly was room for much more.

38450655.review:
I've played/read only a handful of visual novels, maybe 5 total - so it doesn't take a whole lot to impress me relative to the VNs I have read. The only one that's heavily impressed me to date is Spike Chunsoft's 999. That being said, A Kiss For The Petals is quite good, even for someone with little to no interest in the premise. The story didn't hook me or amaze me but I did find it enjoyable regardless. There's very little to complain about here. It has nice art, great voice acting, likeable characters and a solid story. 

It's a VN you're not very likely to fall in love with, but it's also one that's very hard to hate. It's a "Yuri" love story about two polar opposite characters becoming enamored with each other. It's cute, sweet, linear (plus for me because I don't like repeating dialogue) and pretty short. If you have a stronger connection to the story and its themes then this might be a much more touching and emotional VN. Like I said, I can't relate at all but still found it cute and enjoyable enough to warrant the time spent. Go get it in the Humble Mangagamer Bundle if you're even slightly curious.

路人仅推荐bundle包，或降价入。
首先说下我是路人，只了解《花吻》，并没有实际推过，这是第一次玩。其他花吻周边也没有
从galgame来说，这个外传一样性质的，充斥着没钱继续做的感觉。中间又省略一些人物描写，，戛然而止，一脸蒙蔽。。
又因为steam的政策，好像和原作一样的也放不上来，又是bundle获得，那就只能原谅制作方了，但还是感觉价格略贵，感觉25，打折18才符合素质。
画风上，，没有画崩，有多个过场。7分吧
声优也感觉在及格之上，没啥特别亮点。也7分吧
音乐，正常的音乐。没什么好说的，不过一个BGM循环几乎一整个游戏，，让我最后不得不把声音调小了，，
剧情，分章大体来说正常。有些个别的走向有点让人期待，但是结束之后又感觉是不是自己买了假的游戏，去掉了很多部分的感觉。但是又能圆回来。。。emmm。。情感描写是有，但是也感觉缺东西，也能代入。打到结局又让人摸不着头脑“这就结束了？”
并不是很想给这个推荐，但是不推荐又太不合适。可能在我玩了正作之后会有改观吧？
另，感觉前面的那个diss太草率，，难道很多不是神作的普通游戏都是这样么？不过价格是真的略高了，不是很值得。

По суті перед нашим поглядом , зявляється історія типової шкільної буденності, яка приправлена появою чорноволосої статної красуні , яка поступає в душу головній нашій героїні, захоплює її думки та сни і згодом ... З рештує перетягує на темну сторону Юрі .Однак історія незважаючи на свою легкість та просту емоційну подразливість не спрацьовує на повну картину світу , котрий намагається показати. Героїні чомусь страждають не самі по собі, а як ніби грають в театрі. Образ Міси як їжак який хоче бути котиком. То вона ніби холодна принцеса то активна домінантка? Автори чому Ви не впевнилися в ролі та образі героїні? Це реально змішує хорошу історію і робить її просто звичайною, при чім в Юрі жанрі. Це печалить мене.....
Пару слів про музику - вона тут дійсно найслабша з усіх романтичних новел..... Я розчарований....
Графічна частина єдине , що  дало враження не переоціненого, дійсно прекрасна, а ще мене порадувало те, що якщо придивитись то герої не носять трусиків під свіоїми спідницями ;3 Можливо лише це мої фантазії))))
Якщо по вердикту : 
Сюжет - 7/12 - переоцінена історія в якій попри короткість буває нудно (перша частина новели)
Музика - 3/12  - просто жахливо , як для Юрі новели!
Графічне оформлення - 10/12 , прекрасно єдине , що порадувало.
Емоційність - 8/12 - в деяких моментах втрачається відчуття синергії персонажів та їх почуттів, ніби вони грають не себе самих а акторів
Загальна оцінка - 7/12- Історія, котра переоцінена багатьма критиками за красиву графіку, однак втратила свій сюжет в фальшивій грі героїнь..... Я б радив купувати лише на розпродажі.

Поцелуй лепестков - помню, как мы познакомились - это визуальная история, о зарождении любви между двумя подругами в котором самому любви отвели то малую частичку сюжета. По сути перед нашим взором, появляется история типичной школьной обыденности, которая приправлена ​​появлением черноволосой статной красавицы, которая поступает в душу главной нашей героини, захватывает его мнению и сны и позже ... С рештуе перетягивает на темную сторону Юри .Однако история несмотря на свою легкость и простую эмоциональную раздражительность не срабатывает на полную картину мира, который пытается показать. Героини то страдают не сами по себе, а как будто играют в театре. Образ Меси как еж который хочет быть котиком. То она как бы холодная принцесса то активная доминантка? Авторы почему Вы не убедились в роли и образе героини? Это реально смешивает хорошую историю и делает ее просто обычной, при чем в Юре жанре. Это печаль меня .....
Пару слов о музыке - она ​​здесь действительно слабое из всех романтических новелл ..... Я разочарован ....
Графическая часть единственное, что дало впечатления не переоцененного, действительно прекрасна, а еще меня порадовало то, что если присмотреться то герои не носят трусиков под свиоимы юбками, 3 Возможно только это мои фантазии))))
Если по вердикта:
Сюжет - 7/12 - переоценена история в которой несмотря на краткость бывает скучно (первая часть новеллы)
Музыка - 3/12 - просто ужасно, как для Юри новеллы!
Графическое оформление - 10/12, прекрасно единственное, что порадовало.
Эмоциональность - 8/12 - в некоторых моментах теряется ощущение синергии персонажей и их чувств, что они играют не себя а актеров
Общая оценка - 7/12-История, которая переоценена многими критиками за красивую графику, однако потеряла свой сюжет в фальшивой игре героинь ..... Я бы советовал покупать только на распродаже.

37663541.review:
This VN is an all-ages spin-off of the erotic yuri franchise [i]A Kiss for the Petals/Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke o[/i], giving a backstory to one of the major couples featured there, Miya and Risa. As its story in set in the past in relation to rest of the series, it works very well as its own separate thing – you don't need to know anything about the setting or the girls themselves to enjoy it (although there are references to other [i]Sono Hanabira...[/i] titles that can make it that much more interesting for someone who read them).

As for the game itself, it's a very casual, cute romance story about a clash of personalities and a bond developing in unexpected circumstances – nothing especially fresh or innovative, but apart from the somewhat slow start, rather charming and very fun to read through. Risa might start as somewhat annoying, but her tsundere attitude and her interactions with Miya are quite amusing, especially in later parts of the story. It's a kinetic novel, so there're no choices or story routes, and the whole experience feels close to watching a few episodes of a decent yuri anime – there is no replayability here whatsoever, but for the price I've got it for (on -40% sale) I didn't see any reasons to complain.

The romance aspect of the game might feel a bit rushed, but it's also not fully resolved here – while the girls are definitely a couple later on and we take a few peeks at their current relationship, what we're shown in this small, 2 hour story-bit is just the beginnings of their friendship and it's suggested that a lot more happened before they finally came together (obviously, you can find that part of the story in other VNs in the series).

Production qualities are pretty good, although not in any way exceptional – sprites and CGs are nice to look at and serve their purpose well, while maybe the only thing that got my attention was some of the backgrounds, quite detailed and gorgeous. Music just kind of is there, not standing out but also not getting in the way.

[b]Overall, I think this game is very much something aimed at fans or the [i]A Kiss for the Petals[/i] series and yuri fans in general, but might feel lacking for anyone else. Apart from cute romance scenario between two girls, there’s really not much to see here – although for someone like me, it was definitely enough to have two hours of rather fun reading experience.[/b]

37566604.review:
When I put the game in the cart, it's mainly because it was a sale and because I'm very interested in Yuri games. But I was really expecting a game, not a kinetic visual novel, where I just click to pass text and look at new CG or background...

I don't know the series but it doesn't mean that this novel isn't understandable. In fact, it's working perfectly as a stand-alone.

Miya and Risa are going to school when Risa remembered that it's been two years since they've met and became girlfriends.  She dives into her memories, to her first day of high school when she was brushed by the new girl at school, who is quite intriguing and infuriating.

I'm quite in for that kind of story... But I felt like it was missing something important: how they became girlfriends. Because we don't even get to see them kissing for the first time, we don't get more background for the girls for those who aren't following the series. However, I loved how Miya reacted after an outburst and how Risa was very worried after, to the point she threw her perfect attendance to the windows. I was just disappointed that Risa wasn't remembering more: as I don't follow the series, I've supposed that maybe, the story of how the girls became a couple and how some heavy discussions were handled was explained in another game, not released on Steam.

The graphics were good and the soundtrack was very well fitted.  These two aspects are quite strong points: there is no real fanservice in there (apart short skirts but well, it's not really what's put in the light) and the girls are quite cute in their reactions.

It was a nice novel. But if I was you, I would wait for a discount and not buy it at full price: I feel like the game is missing something to be really worthy of 8 bucks. Apart for that, it was a nice moment, so why not?

34495040.review:
[h1]GET IT FOR ANOTHER PERFECT ACHIEVEMENT GAME![/h1]
Keep pressing Space until the game is over and you're all set. 100% Achivement, Yey!

[spoiler]If that's not your goal, I wouldn't recommend this game, EVER.[/spoiler]
Let's talk about it a little bit in depth.

[b]Characters: [/b]
1 whiny and meddlesome girl who loves to poke her nose into others' business and gets angry all the time for nothing;
1 unrealistically genius and ostentatious girl who gets perfect scores all the time, whose family is super rich so that she skips almost every class and wouldn't get into trouble, who has everything you dream of, and of course according to cliche this perfect lonely girl must have a sympathetic family, which is mentioned but not explored whatsoever in the story. (Then what's explored in the story, you might ask? Well, see below for story.)

[b]Story:[/b] (Spoiler Alert? Nah, I don't think so.)
Everything begins with that Nosy girl chasing that Class Skipper girl every day.
[spoiler]Day after day after day after day after day after day after day after day...[/spoiler]
And all of a sudden...BOOOO! they got into a relationship! Wooooo! 
[spoiler]Who knows how? They just got together! Nobody tells you how![/spoiler]
[spoiler]You have no idea how embarrassed I was and how much I wanted to close the game (if not for the full achievement I absolutely would have) when I had to go through the cooked-up conversations.[/spoiler]
Besides, as I mentioned before, I was expecting, at least, the game to tell me something about the tragic past of the second girl in other ways (of course she refused to talk about it during conversations), but it didn't. [spoiler]Should've known that better *sigh*[/spoiler]
By the way, there's only this one ending. Nothing involves your choice. All you need to do is to sit and click your mouse like a robot.


[b]Other Notes:[/b]
[b][u]Approximate Gameplay Time:[/u][/b] < 2 Hours [spoiler]How much does the game cost, by the way?[/spoiler]
[b][u]Game Arts and Graphics:[/u][/b] It was ONLY them two characters, and they didn't go to too many places. I can't say too much about the art style, which depends heavily on personal preferences, but I can tell you the CGs are SUPER DUPER REPETITIVE. 
[b][u]Music:[/u][/b] Didn't leave me an impression. So, whatever.

[b]Conclusion:[/b]
I really don't get some of the Japanese Animes and their fans now...
Why would people even like this sort of made-up BS...
Well...If you just wanna watch two girls doing those guilty pleasure things, [spoiler]I have to admit that's my initial intention, but the worst game experience ever COMPLETELY deprives you of the guilty pleasure of watching Yuri.[/spoiler]you can give it a try, though.

34476315.review:
Finished it but was expecting more out of it...

My Personal Opinion :
Graphics - 6/10 (The art style seems better in a better engine.)
Gameplay - 3/10 (Aside from Transitions and camera zooms, there really is little to no gameplay which means its like a novel your reading, what would you expect from a lot of VN like this.)
Story - 6/10 (It's just a reminiscence of how Miya and Risa met, not much to tell there.)
Sound - 7/10 (At least the game is voiced, I really liked that about some part of VN's.)
Heart - 8/10 (The Cuteness of the art style for Miya is too cute.)
Overall rating - 6/10 (It's so short it consumed less than what I expected but the stuffs I earned are worth it.)
Is it worth it? - Yes and No. (The trading cards are good and the emoticons are very worth it other than that its not.)

Last Note : A simple word for this is ENJOY!

邂逅、结缘、成熟、融合，

我所感受到的，就是这样。
这是会让你有着——
呀，百合真是太美好了、恋爱，真是太美好了！

33717775.review:
（一段是我在发出这篇评论以后收到了非常多的diss之后的补充：我觉得这个游戏，这个前传，这个没有限制级内容的前传，让我玩了一半就开始觉得索然无味，就开始觉得不舒服，那么我必然会认为，这样的团队做出的作品，就算是正传部分，就算是喜闻乐见的r18部分，也不会让我提起任何兴趣。就是这样，我之前写的评测里面已经说得很明白我一点也不喜欢美术、情节、演出、表现、内容，我认为这是一个素质很普通很无趣的百合游戏。我不知道跑到下面来留言的粉想说明什么，这个游戏在我玩的时候已经让我觉得不舒服。现在你们这些粉已经让我感觉这个游戏很恶心了。）

（再补充一句，对于下面评论里这位没理解我表达的我有多不喜欢这游戏就认为是没有r18内容导致我不喜欢这游戏的汉化组人员表示抱歉，我高估了你的理解力，你的头几句评论让我觉得你是没玩过这游戏所以才会觉得r18内容能让一个对正常内容及其失望的人觉得好一点。我就解释在这里，我知道有人是听不进去的。虽然这篇评论让我隔一段时间就添点堵，但我想了想我会坚持不删这篇评论的，希望能有和我想法相似的看到这篇评论的人可以回避这个糟糕的作品。汉化组那句话是我当时的气话，非常抱歉，我相信汉化组的其他人不一定都是这样。）

因为是著名的花吻系列，还是百合，还是特别好评，就大意了。我真诚地想给个差评，这个游戏很没意思，真的。
但是退款还是懒得退了，就当支持中文吧。还是希望有中文的游戏越来越多。

流程很短，就是讲两个人刚刚开始认识的故事，连为什么会变成恋人也交代得很肤浅，不完整，就算是系列的一部分，作为单独售卖的游戏还是很没有诚心，这根本不算一个完整的故事。
角色上我感受不到两个主角对我的吸引力，为了突出女性性征而无视质感和重力的立绘，生硬的衣褶，让人觉得很粗糙。剧情拖沓、浮浅，角色对话让人觉得索然无味，仿佛只是一个无聊设定的普通陈述。以及除了主角以外可以说是没有别的角色，同学和老师的设定非常脸谱化，连名字也没有，连标号也会在不同人物上重复出现，体验非常糟糕。配角没有任何精彩之处，配角的配音甚至能让不是日语母语的人感受到尴尬。

不想扯到别的游戏以免被人说黑，但花吻这个作品，作为女性我从中感受不到任何女孩子之间会有的欲说还休的细腻情感。

我想知道，百合对你们来说就是两个日系画风的小女孩被设定成恋人关系进行普通的互动，牵个手接个吻就让你们觉得满足了？
就算是，但我也想表达，这样的作品，让我觉得很沮丧。这是一部糟糕的百合作品。

（补充一句，你们非要让我说出难听的话吗，在这作之中我看到了恶臭的男性向趣味）

《その花びらにくちづけを》（花吻在上）十八禁视觉小说系列由同人游戏社团ふぐり屋制作，起始于2006年11月25日，目前已发行23部作品，相关内容包含轻小说，广播剧，动画等。

《その花びらにくちづけを　出会った顷の思い出に》为全年龄版本的游戏，由圣ミカエル女子学园制作，最初于2015年3月13日发行于Android和IOS平台，后移植PC平台，由MangaGamer在2015年9月25日发行于steam平台，语言为英文。讲述了安昙璃纱回忆和绫濑美夜相遇时的故事。

《その花びらにくちづけを あなたと恋人つなぎ》在2010年7月30日发行OVA，讲述了泽口麻衣想尽办法寻找机会帮助性格奇怪的转学生川村玲绪和班上同学搞好关系，但却遭到了川村玲绪的告白的事情。

《その花びらにくちづけを》系列游戏中登场了织田七海，松原优菜，北嶋枫，北嶋纱良，泽口麻衣，川村玲绪等多位性格特征明显的角色，她们之间有着或简单或复杂的人物关系。

30340170.review:
It's a nice little introduction into the Sono Hanabira franchise, however it arguably might be more suited to people who are already fans of the franchise.

It plays out the same way as the main entries, but without the lewd elements. Frankly, there is not much to it. Girl meets girl, they attract each other, but their different personalities cause them to clash (while tying them even more to each other), there's a bit of drama (but nothing major) and at the end, they're pretty lovey-dovey (while still having differences). The absence of sex scenes, with nothing (like a bigger or more dramatic storiy) to balance it out, is a rather noticeable flaw. This makes "Remembering How We Met" a nice all-ages alternative, but certainly not the highest point of the franchise.

What remains is a sweet and cute little yuri story and that has always been Sono Hanabira's main appeal. If you like such things, then this VN could really be to your liking (especially if you don't like hentai, which would render the majority of the series unappealing). However, if you're not already a fan of Sono Hanabira (possibly even then), it might be better to wait for a sale. Aside from having a rather low-key story, this VN is very short and doesn't even contain choices (although since there are never different routes or endings, they've always been rather pointless in Sono Hanabira).

A Kiss For the Petals ~ Remembering How We Met.
A sweet visual novel involving two high school girls (Risa and Miya) in a yuri relationship. The story tells us how the couple got together.

Pros:
Voice Acting- Yay! Finally, I found a VN that actually has voices. The voices are pretty cute ^^

CGs- Good artwork, that is all I have to say.

Changing Perspective- This is something that isn't common in Visual Novels, the ability to change perspectives. Half of the story, you get to learn from Risa's perspective, and half from Miya's perspective.

Story- Story is pretty smooth and easy to understand... except for the last chapter.

Music- Love it :)


Cons:
No Routes- A VN without any different routes, thats a first, right? I kinda wish there was a good and/or bad ending to this game.

Last Chapter- Okay, I admit it, the previous chapters were understandable until this chapter. In summary: Last Chapter~ building up tension and relationship. Last Chapter: BAM, Yuri stuff happening. There was a whole time frame missing there.


Yeah, I had fun with this game, even though it made me facepalm a couple of times.

28568407.review:
[u][h1]Introduction[/h1][/u]
     The SonoHana Series, a bunch of visual novels that revolve around the relationship of two girls at St. Michael Girls’ School, the series is very well known and loved by yuri fans. This was the first official English release of a title from this series. Usually this series covers some 18+ scenes, however this is steam, so this was just a short and sweet love story suitable for all ages.
     This novel is what you call in fanfiction terms a “pre-slash”. Which means it doesn’t show the start of the romantic relationship, but rather their friendship. [b]Azumi Risa[/b] is the sincere, kind and dependable girl loved by everyone at her school.[b] Ayase Miya[/b] is the new transfer student. The student that has perfect grades and fits into the "silent and cool" type of character, until she starts skipping most classes. Risa can’t stand for having someone doing that in her class, and so she makes it her mission to get Miya to stop playing truant.


[u][h1] Thoughts about the novel[/h1][/u]
     The girls' personalities were very lovable and cute and very well developed throughout the short playtime of the novel. As much as how the main focus in the novel was about their school life, we got glimpses about their personal lifes. Namely, a slight idea about the relationship between the girls and their families. The interactions between the girls were really entertaining while the serious moments between them were quite touching. The dialogue in the novel didnt seem forced like most romance novels and it felt a lot more natural and it was backed up by the well done translation of the original.
     
     The art was very nice, but there are only apperances of the two main characters despite some other girls and teaches being involved in some of the conversations. The novel could have used more background variety and most of the CGs were really similar to each other. The voice acting for the two lead characters was great, but the supporting characters had terrible voice acting sadly. They should have left out the voiceovers for the extra characters since they didn't bother creating sprites for them.
     
These issues aside, I'd highly recommend "A Kiss For The Petals - Remembering How We Met" for someone looking to put in a few hours in reading the background of a very cute and pure love story, it's a short read. But the playtime was just enough to tell the simply charming story of these two lovely girls.

This novel is well-written and the couple is very lovable. However, it's far too short. The title is quite literal; this is the story of the *start* of a very nice yuri relationship. It pretty much ended just as I was getting emotionally attached to the protagonists. Based on the product description, I gather that this is just one entry in a series, which is the only way the story's brevity makes any sense. I don't think any of the other novels are on Steam at the moment, which is unfortunate; this little entry has made me curious enough to read more.

The art is about average for a high-end visual novel (that is to say, very good). The music is okay, but none of the tracks stick out in my mind.

TLDR: Worth $8 if you're really fond of yuri. If your taste runs more to romance generally, wait until it's a few bucks off.

25715581.review:
An extremely minimalist story about how two girls met and became friends. The perspective of the story switches between the past and present as it is basically just about the two girls reflecting on their past together. 

They are apparently lovers in the present, but you never see how they developed their friendship into a romantic relationship. Things are brought up and never expended upon, like how one of the protagonists has issues with her parents. It's because of this that this story feels incomplete. It feels like it is 1/3rd of a complete package. This isn't an issue with there only being one route and zero choices but an issue with the fact that the story ends before it even begins.

If you like the yuri genre and this VN is on sale then I suppose it is worth your time if you're curious and have money to blow. What I experienced wasn't dreadful or anything, what is there is acceptable. The amount of content and price are simply too lopsided for a straight reccomendation. Also the choice of sound effects in this game are silly. For instance, whenever the homeroom class in the story, a class of a girls, begin clapping... It sounds like a stadium full of people cheering. Not like a stadium of even females cheering either. It's weird.

Note: This isn't a straight reccomendation as I couldn't choose a neutral option between yes and no. Had I been able to, I would have done so.

[h1]A Kiss For The Petals – Remembering How We Met[/h1]

Histoire visuelle courte, j’ai mis 5h mais si vous êtes à l’aise avec la langue vous en mettrez moins. On fait la connaissance de Risa et sa petite amie Miya qui vont nous plonger dans leurs souvenirs et nous faire revivre l’histoire de leur rencontre et des différents événements qui vont les rapprocher. L’histoire est linéaire, sans choix, assez superficielle dans le développement des personnages et prévisible mais néanmoins bien écrite, très mignonne et rafraichissante j’ai passé un agréablement moment à la lire.  Quant aux graphismes ils sont très beaux et la musique n’est pas désagréable à écouter. 

[h1]En conclusion : [/h1]
Une histoire visuelle courte et peu approfondie qui ne marquera pas spécialement vos esprits mais qui pourra vous donner le sourire et vous faire passer un bon moment l’espace d’une soirée. Je le recommande plutôt en solde   

[b]Bilan : 6,5/10 (graphismes : 8/10 ; histoire : 5/10) [/b]

[h1]English summary : [/h1]
Short and a bit superficial VN which does not make a deep impression but can make you smile and have a good time for an evening. I recommend it on sale

24734116.review:
I'll say this right off the bat - I like the novel and I think it's a decent entry into the yuri genre.It took me way too long to finish it, however, and other yuri entries such as Highway Blossoms and Kindred Spirits on the Roof simply eclipse this novel by a fairly wide margin. 

Pacing was a bit off, personally. The latter part of the novel felt very rushed and I feel like a more gradual climax would have done a whole lot of good. I understand that this really isn't the specialty of St. Michael's; they're famous for their short and sweet yuri novels, after all. I feel like it needed a little more fleshing out, but I also think that I'm sort of comparing it with the above-mentioned novels - and it just feels a little unfair.

Let me put it this way: If I were to liken Highway Blossoms to a yuri meal and Kindred Spirits to be, well, a yuritopia, this novel is a yuri snack bag - light, short, and sweet. I just happened to think grabbing onto the snack bag in the middle of yuritopia was a good idea.

Still worth buying on sale if you're interested!

23990215.review:
[i]A Kiss for the Petals - Remembering How We Met[/i] is actually the 18th installment of the long-running Sono Hanabira series, but it's the first one to be localized.

I myself knew very little about this series going in, all I had seen of it was the OVA (which is soft hentai, so be wary of that) and what I had read up on Wikipedia out of curiosity.

Sono Hanabira is set in the all-girls St. Michaels Academy, and this specific entry focuses on 2 girls named Risa and Miya. The whole game is really just a massive flashback to how the two became a couple, and it only takes about 3-5 hours depending on how fast you read to finish the whole thing. It is a fun read, lots of teasing and plenty of stuff to snark at, but I wouldn't say this there's a lot of substance to this one.

Graphically, it is quite nice, lots of bright and appealing colors, well-drawn and designed characters, and CGs are all of high quality (Chibi Risa 2cute4me).

The sound is great, too. The voice acting is what you'd expect, japanese vocals, high pitched voices, Risa sounds flustered half the time, and Miya pulls off the titilating tone very well. The music is basic, it's there and does its job, but I can't remember much of it off the top of my head.

Gameplay wise...there is none. This game is strictly a Kinetic Novel, meaning there are no choices to be made, all you do is read. It's a good read, but it would help if it were a bit longer or I knew more about these characters.

I can see why they would translate this one first, though. Since this series as a whole is yuri and does feature sex scenes, testing the waters with this was a good move. Now, chances are that most people who bought this game were already fans of Sono Hanabira, but it definitely made me want more. I liked Risa and Miya and they played off each other fairly well, and if they translate the rest of the games, I'd be down for that. 

Granted, 8 bucks is pretty damn steep for something like this, especially if you're not someone like me who can read VNs over and over again and not get bored, so if you're on the fence about this series, I'd say wait for a sale.

If the other games do come out on steam, I'll consider them, Fuguriya deserves some support from us Westerners.

I'm a huge fan of the Sono Hanabira (A Kiss for the Petals) series, specifically the first 
[url=https://listlessink.wordpress.com/sono-hanabira-ni-kuchizuke-wo-series/] 10 games [/url]; I love the peaceful nature of this entire universe as well as the diverse dynamics of each couple. I've been dying to play the 11th game and beyond, and to get the opportunity to not only play a kind of "prequel" to the 11th-12th game as well as to finally have an official English release is [i]beyond[/i] amazing. This VN is not only a great addition to the original lineup, but "Remembering How We Met" is also a superb game for those new to the gentle and feminine world of SHNKW and current fans alike. TLDR;

[b]CONS![/b][list]
[*]  "All ages" means [i]no[/i] sex scenes this time (a bummer, as the other games are PACKED full of amazing yuri scenes)
[*]  Too short; I personally wish this game were longer
[/list]

[b]PROS![/b]
[list]
[*] Beautiful Art
[*] Lovely Character Design and Development
[*] Cute Voice Work
[*] Adorable Yuri Fluff and Heartwarming Interaction
[*] Friendly to anyone new to the series itself; no previous game knowledge needed!
[*] Leading up to the 11th installment of the "A Kiss for the Petals" series (so I'm definitely hoping for more!)
[*] Supports the potential production and release of future SonoHana VN's!
[/list]

I highly suggest this game; the art (by Peko) is iridescent and beautiful and the character interactions are as charming and romantic as ever. Please, Fuguriya, YurinYurin, and Mangagamer; give the west more SonoHana to fall in love with!

23783076.review:
Are you searching for meaning in life? Tired of pondering the intricacies of the greater universe unfathomable?
"A Kiss For The Petals" or Sono Hanabira is the answer. It is the shining beacon of respite in a world without enough yuri. When you may have troubled yourself as to life's mundane purpose, you smile, knowing that you must trouble yourself no longer, for it is done, and Sono Hanabira is on Steam.
Notes:
This was originally a mobile/iPhone supplementary game in the Sono Hanabira series, and this is clearly an experimental English license. Fans will be supporting this release wildly for further localizations, and for newcomers, it may seem a bit overblown. This is not a long visual novel, nor is it entirely representative of Sono Hanabira as a whole. With that said...
"What's with 'Sono Hanabira?'"
For long-time fans of the series, this is the seventeenth game, and one of two that are 'all-ages' (the other being Hanahira, for those of you interested in continuing your adventure into Sono Hanabira while staying within the 'all-ages space). Sono Hanabira started as a doujin nukige (doujin: amateur work by a small group of individuals; nukige: visual novel where the plot is only around to allow for 'plot') that was very well received for its tone, atmosphere, and high-quality character designs.
"Finally, yuri done right!"
A core cast of couples was developed, and multiple releases furthered the story between each of them. The success was too much to ignore, and after ten doujin releases, the company 'Yurin Yurin' was founded and it became a professional endeavour. "St. Michael's Girl's School - Maidens of Michael" was released as a full length visual novel that connected, expanded, and meaningfully explored the characters in a way that previous entries didn't have room for. A shorter sequel was released, focusing on the new couple Risa and Miya (the ones featured in this game!), as were wholly original ventures (such as ones focusing on a post-high school Nursing School) and even a "New Generations" series re-boot with an entirely new cast, as 'Yurin Yurin' was replaced as developers by 'St. Michael's Girl's Academy' (again, a company founded entirely for this venture).
At this point, fans are dying to play Sono Hanabira in its wholly professional and full length visual novel glory, but, it has far outpaced the fan translators and official English licensing and releases are wanted. So, with everything we've got, fans support Sono Hanabira in its fullest with this game! With enough support, the more lengthy games will be licensed, and the age of yuri can be heralded!

22017843.review:
A cute little yuri VN. There's nothing particularly suggestive about it save a moment near the end and, of course, the fact that it's a story featuring two girls (gasp). The game is originally a mobile port and doesn't have any of the mature themes the rest of the series does  (thanks, Kimchi).

Anywho.... 'A Kiss For The Petals--Remembering How We Met' is exactly as the title says: it tells the story of two girls who are reminiscing on how their relationship started. It begins in the present, flashes back to the past, and returns to the present once more for the wrap-up.

Miya and Risa are, of course, attendees of an all-girls school, cute, brilliant students (one do-gooder and one delinquent), and utterly parent and/or guardian-less. Typical Japanese school girls.  Their world is presented in static images and their portraits move just a bit to fit whatever they're saying on screen. At key points in dialogue, you sometimes get a different static image featuring one or both girls as a background and those can be viewed in the "extra" tab in the main menu. From that menu, you can also listen to the BGM and click through the "CG"s which reflect the minor changes in static images all in a sequence so that it kind-of-sort-of looks like a short clip/gif. 

Everything is fully voice acted, with the exception of narration, in Japanese.

No other characters get a graphical representation or even a name. They are generic "Student A" or "Teacher." I suppose they get glossed over because they're not central to the plot, but that level of detail would have been nice. As it was, the world felt empty--devoid of only two teens in love and a handful of faceless, nameless background characters. I can count them on both hands: Students A-D, Driver, and Teacher. Still, it's a minor gripe.

It'll take you around 2 hours to read through this and, after doing so, there won't be much reason to fire this game back up except to collect card drops seeing as there aren't any decisions to be made that could affect the story. You're just along for the ride... and that's okay.

Bottom line: short and sweet. 7.99 is a little steep, but it's worth a look if you're looking for a yuri love story that'll give you cavities.

21417457.review:
A Kiss For The Petals - Remembering How We Met is an adorable shoujo-ai (focus on lesbian relationships, but without explicit sexual content) kinetic novel (a kind of visual novel that doesn't have any choices or alternate routes in it) detailing, as the title itself reveals, how the game's schoolgirl couple, Miya and Risa, met and came to know one-another. It's a slight experience, taking all of 1 or 2 hours to read in its entirety if you skip through the Japanese voice acting. The production quality of the game is high, with eye-catching CGs, unobtrusive music, strong voice acting and what looks to be an excellent and very well-edited translation from MangaGamer.

Story-wise, this is a leisurely and very cute story that paints a vivid portrait of its central characters and their peculiar cat-and-mouse relationship (Risa, a strict middle class student who strives to be an exemplar to her primarily rich and pampered schoolmates, spends most of the game obsessively trying to convince Miya, a highly intelligent but bored and possibly unhappy girl in her freshman class, to attend classes and become a more responsible student). It's fun to watch this dynamic evolve as they gradually start to become something more to one-another.

If I have a complaint, it's that, for all of the build-up, we're never actually allowed to see when these two decide to fully embrace their feelings and confess to one-another. While this might seem like a bit of a cliche, it's a standard part of any romantic storyline, and the game ending without us ever seeing the biggest transition point in their relationship is a bit... anti-climatic. We see their loving and apparently passionate relationship after they become girlfriends, and we see most of the build-up to the change in their relationship, but the climax of the narrative is missing. I also feel that certain issues related to the character Miya's past are hinted at and then abruptly dropped, which was also disappointing.

With that said, the engaging character writing, high production values, and excellent translation still make this more than worth the paltry asking price. I enjoyed every moment of my time available with this game, and I'd love to see more accessible shoujo-ai become available on Steam.

20966162.review:
This game pretty much opened my eyes to the yuri genre.

[h1]Story[/h1]
The game revolves the odd relationship around a goody two shoes class rep and a misfit with a troubled family and how they fell in love with eachother.

[h1]Characters[/h1]
I genuinely loved both the lovers and how opposites really do attract.

Risa:
   Our typical hardworking student that cares a little too much on grades and attendance. Tends to get flustered alot. One day walking to school, she sees a girl and shes admires her beauty. This admiration becomes an obsession(she is to naive to realize she has a crush on Miya). The rest of the story is Risa stalking Miya and trying to get her to attend class.

Miya:
   Our calm and collected, smartass misfit. She likes to skip class and finds school work boring. [spoiler]She hates her parents and transfered to St. Michaels to spite them. Whenever someone mentions her parents, she becomes angered.[/spoiler] She is a bit of a pervert.

[h1]Sexual Content[/h1]
Contrary to the Steam tags for this game, this game actually has no nudity or sex, though this game does mention sex and [spoiler]straight up has Miya embracing Risa and asking her to have sex with her, but that never goes anywhere.[/spoiler] If you bought or planning to buy this expecting it to be an eroge, you are gonna be disappointed.

The only reason the game is age-gated is that the game itself is part of an eroge series.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
This game I feel is a great introduction to the Sonohana series. I'm wondering what else Sonohana has to offer(I have seen the "anime" adaptation of "Joined in Love with You" and wonder if the original game isn't just that "particular kind of scene"). Overall I found "Remembering How We Met" a really enjoyable romance.

Thank you Demo-senpai for introducing me to such a beautiful series.

20365146.review:
[h1] A kiss For the Petals- Remembering How we met Review	[/h1]

Before I start my review, I have to say that I'm a huge fan of yuri anime/manga/content in general, which means that even before starting playing the game I was predisposed to review it in a favorable way, also as one of the first yuri game available on steam, it was a must buy for me even before reading anything about it or seeing any videos about it.

That being said, I still plan to review it for what it is and be fair about it.

 [b] So, what is A kiss For The Petals- Remembering How We Met?	[/b]

To start of, it's good to know what kind of game this is. To make this clear, this is purely a Visual Novel: A written story that the player reads and may or may not interact with. This kind of gender isn't that common in non-asian markets, but it has been picking up momentum in the last couple of years with digital distribution being what it is now.

[b] Is this game Yuri? What is yuri?	[/b]
To give the short answer: yes this is a yuri game, there is no gray zone or subtext, no way to see it any other way, this game is 100% yuri. So what is yuri? It's a medium that has it's main aspect revolve around romance between two girls/woman. As I mentioned earlier, the game centers 100% around a romantic story between the 2 main characters. No male characters exist here and secondary characters are kept to a minimum.

[b] THE REVIEW	[/b]


[u] The good	[/u]

[b] The art : [/b]
The art, especially that of the two main characters is great. Both characters look cute, have great expressions and the game CG'S are all around great. The backgrounds, while not all that special, do set up a nice little environment.

[b] The main voice acting : [/b] 
The voice acting for the two main characters; Risa and Miya, is great. It shows emotion, is varied and as many fans of this type of game enjoy, is in japanese.

[b] The chemistry between the main characters [/b]
The bread and butter of the game: the romance between Risa and Miya is adorable. While this story won't win any awards for it's originality or it's social commentaries, it's easy to enjoy the back and forth between the two and it's a cute, heartwarming story.

[u] The Bad [/u]

[b] It's too short [/b]
As I said above, the story is cute and the chemistry is there, but the game is just way too short. The complete story can be finished in just a couple of hours. Also, a lot of back story for the two main characters is only vaguely explained, leaving lots of unanswered questions and makes it feel as if some of the main story's obstacles were taken out.

[b] The pacing is a bit weird [/b]
This can also be attributed to the shortness of the game, but as I mentioned, the pacing is a bit off, especially during the last quarter of the game. The story of the game is mostly told as a big flashback, which is being told by the main characters. The start of the story goes in great details as to the daily interactions between Miya and Risa, but as the story approaches it's end, a good chunk of the story feels as if it's been left out. To say more would spoil the story line, but it feels as if it were missing a chapter or two during the ending.

[u] Additional comments [/u]
While this can't be added as a good or bad point, the game is linear from start to finish. It offers no choices, no branching paths and no alternate endings. While this was the way the game was made, it might disappoint some fans.

A second point and a very important one for some.The game doesn't have any adult content whatsoever. This however isn't limited to the steam version as there are no "adult" or "complete" versions of the game. This version is the full and complete version of the game.

All in all, A kiss for the Petals- remembering How We Met is a cute little yuri visual novel and a great way to get into this type of game. While it won't be remembered as a masterpiece and it is a bit on the short side, I would still recommend it to fans of yuri games or visual novels or for people that want a nice short way to try it out. 

[h1] The Score: 3.5/5	[/h1]

A Kiss For The Petals - Remembering How We Met is a kinetic visual novel, meaning there are no choices, so people going into it expecting to do more than click/press Enter/press space are going to be disappointed. 

The story is pretty sweet. It follows the memories of two girlfriends as they remember how they first were introduced. Unfortunately, as this is a side-story for the main series of games, the actual coupling of the two is not shown, only their first few weeks of school. The official release of the rest of this series is dependant on the success of this game.

Those looking for a sweet and short (very short) yuri story should check this out.

Give it a go!

Sugerencias y mejoras
-Traducción a otros idiomas (español)
-Revisión de traducción al ingles.

Realmente espero que steam admita otras entregas de esta saga o similares <3 desde luego por rentabilidad no tienen excusa.

19374480.review:
著名的《亲吻那片花瓣》系列（别名《花吻在上》），在百合爱好者中名气非常大，被称为是“百合游戏的金字塔”。

这个系列为人所周知有个很重要的原因——因为它出了一部R-18 OVA，即使在现在里番众多的情况下，百合里番的数量也是屈指可数，而在这其中，这一部的优美画风又让它更显得鹤立鸡群。



《亲吻那片花瓣》系列目前为止出了21部游戏，其中有两部是全年龄游戏。这就是其中一部。

这个游戏原本是出在手机端上（安卓IOS皆有），后来移植到PC端，很可惜的是这个游戏只有英文版，不过在社区中心里有人分享了日文补丁（其实就是手机端上的日文文本）。

这一部讲述的是在圣米迦勒女子学院上学的安昙璃纱和她的恋人绫濑美夜相遇时的故事。有一天班上突然转来了一个别扭的转校生，她天资聪慧，运动神经拔群，而这位天才居然被分配坐在了璃纱的隔壁桌。她不苟言笑，对谁都是礼貌待人，但是却似乎有点难以接近，让璃纱对这名新同学非常在意。然而突然有一天，[b]这名天才同学开始逃课了[/b]？！死认真的班长怎么可能对此坐视不管呢？天才逃、班长追，在下课后的校园内你追我赶的纯爱校园剧就此展开。

剧情上来说，这就是一个序章，大概连前作都算不上，隐约发现了一个问题，但是不深入探究，也不去尝试解决，毕竟要到本篇《亲吻那片花瓣 画室的恋人们》时才会深入涉及，这里就只是蜻蜓点水点一下而已。所以第一次接触花吻并且想要看剧情的人可能会失望而归了。推荐给喜欢清水向百合故事的人群。



PEKO的画风很可爱，特别是Q版CG，每次都是我最期待的部分。可惜这一部对比以前的系列作CG质量能感到明显的下降。这是我对这一部作品唯一感到不满的地方。其它地方没得说，整体的画风都不错，音乐很好听，故事也还算不错。



再说一下只有对这个系列了解比较深的人才能感受到的亮点：

·这是这个系列中第一次描述了上课中的景象

·这是这个系列中第一次在日本以外的地方卖（官方甚至还到台湾的开拓动漫祭中卖steam序列号）



特别是描述两人上课时的互动这一点我觉得很感动，花吻系列出了这么多部，对上课时的互动描写却基本是零。几乎都集中在了校外，上课前，下课后，放学后。这一部补充了这方面的描写，让我觉得很满足。



下面是关于这部作品的一点豆知识，并不是很重要所以隐藏起来。

[spoiler] 安曇璃紗的声优黒井音瑚的读音是くろいねこ，跟黒い猫（くろいねこ）同音，也就是黑猫的意思，这是一个相当可爱的名字。

玩了游戏对自行车部的二人产生兴趣的话可以去听听官方广播ゆりりんラジオ，主持人是安曇璃紗（黒井音瑚）和綾瀬美夜（秋本ねりね）。秋本ねりね那带有磁性的声音非常的性感，即使是平常说话这个特性也完全掩盖不掉，喜欢的人请务必去听听看！

路人角色的声优基本上都是系列主角声优配音的，当然也有某些例外。

以下提到的是在玲緒っぽいらじお中提到基本上可以确定的路人声优。

女子A的cv是あさおすずね（在《亲吻那片花瓣 天使们的约定》中为主要角色稲取晶配音）

女子B的cv是一ノ瀬心香（在《亲吻那片花瓣 天使们的憧憬》中为主要角色高尾千秋配音）

女子C的cv是真鶴コウ（在《亲吻那片花瓣 米卡艾鲁的少女们》中为角色蓬莱泉丽奈配音） 

老师的cv是据说曾经所有龙套都由她一个人配的京藤サナ

真鶴コウ的演技真的是很特别浮夸，有兴趣的可以去找一找女子C说话的部分仔细听听看，这人真的是一开口就能逗人大笑，表现得非常夸张。[/spoiler] 

优点以及缺点:

+画风可爱

+声优声音好听

-CG质量有所下降





总的来说，这是一部质量不错的百合AVG游戏，推荐给喜欢百合游戏的人以及日呆。

卡牌价格偏高，不过徽章很好看，有兴趣的话也可以去合个徽章。

19227594.review:
百合ヴィジュアルノベル

[h1]概要[/h1]
日本の18禁百合ゲーとしては最も知名度の高いシリーズ
今作はその中で唯一の全年齢だった"出会った頃の思い出に"の英語版
主人公はシリーズ初の大ボリューム作品"ミカエルの乙女たち"で初登場だった璃紗と美夜

[h1]ストーリー[/h1]
ふたりが付き合う"ミカエルの乙女たち"より前
聖ミカエル女子学園の高等部に入学した璃紗と美夜
マジメな璃紗は、いつも授業をサボる美夜を日課のように追いかけまわしていた
初めは璃紗を煩わしがっていた美夜だが、その感情が少しづつ変わっていく

[h1]その他[/h1]
・ストーリー短い
・分岐無し
・CG全16枚
・日本語フルボイス
・字幕は英語のみ(自分で日本語化ファイル作りました)
・他シリーズのキャラは一切登場せず(玲緒が小さくてうるさい先輩として回想されるのみ)

[h1]最後に[/h1]
この作品とは関係ないけれど、その花シリーズについて
・性描写の生々しさは他の百合エロゲーの中ではちょっと低め
　　生々しさが足りなければ他の18禁作品を
　　もっとサッパリしたのが良ければ全年齢や一部の18禁作品を遊ぶのが吉
・シリーズ2作目の"あなたと恋人つなぎ"はアニメになってる(名作やぞ！)
・初期の作品は立ち絵が古臭い("ミカエルの乙女たち"からは絵が一新される)
・他にも看護学校シリーズやニュージェネなんかもあるけどよく知らん

あとシナリオの日吉ひより。お前円まどかだろ

18258077.review:
Very cute but utterly brainless.

This is the story of how two girls who are now dating met each other and spent months not getting along very well at all. 

The majority of this VN is a tale about when they weren't in love and were mostly in conflict.

The characterisations are really shallow, any real feeling of human personality has been replaced by "conformity" vs "non-conformity", we never find out any specifics of the source of Miya's troubles at home, and I found it overall really unsatisfying. And rather boring. I feel like the sales blurb on the store pretty much sums up the entire story. 

Artwork is pretty. Music is pleasant but bland. No specific issues with the quality of translation.

I wouldn't dismiss the rest of this series based on this game, but I wouldn't recommend this game to others unless they very specifically liked shallow stories about cute girls miscommunicating and being angry for pointless reasons.

18249960.review:
One of the greatest works of art in human history--

When Leopardi wrote his poems, he was searching for something, for a sense of *more*, for a meaning, for, in a word, transcendence -- that finds expression in every sentence, nay, every word and sentence of this masterpiece: right down to the vowels. The only way to transcendence -- is this game.

When Nietzsche developed his philosophy he wanted to escape from the assumptions and misconceptions of European society and culture, to become truly a self; to date the only work of art that would assist one in becoming an Ubermensch - to be become *what one is*-- is this game. 

When Sartre wrote his No Exit and Nausea, he was trying to express the strange incoherence of existence that lies behind our built-up beliefs and behaviours, to show how Radical Freedom is the fact of our lives. The only path one can walk to fulfill your potential to be a self, to truly exist,  -- is this game.

When Pessoa wrote his "factless autobiography" he was trying to express the inexpressible tedium of life, to express through paradox the fact that even the idea of paradox is a paradox; for individuality is the containing of paradoxes in our selves, yet to nothing, for tedium continues to crush us. But the only way to escape the pain of living -- is this game. 

When Kafka wrote his Trial and Metamorphosis he was able to show the absurdity of human relationships, the fragility of so-called love, and justice and law: but the only thing that can truly express these truths: -- is this game. 

When Cioran wrote about his times at the peaks of despair, about his bottomless white nights of insommia, he was trying to show the "irrational nature of existence which continues itself without reason": but the only work of art that can show this to us, so far: -- is this game. 

And, when each of us stops for just a moment, as we wake up and cringe ourselves out of our beds and anticipate the disasters, misery and shame that the day will bring us; what are we looking for? The beauty of yuri is the only thing that justifies life, for in reading yuri we lose everything to the purity and gain nothing... -- for what is there to be gained from the world? Nothing. The world is material for our intrepretation of the world, but all of these intrepretations, being personal, are meaningless. Therefore only yuri allows us to express our radical freedom, to survive our white nights, to give solidity to our love, and our society, to allow our paradoxes to form a beautiful whole, to find transcendence, to become what we are: the only way to survive the world we live in -- is yuri.

18249446.review:
동인 서클로 시작하여, 지금은 아마도 백합 팬덤에서 모르는 사람을 더 찾아보기 힘들 “그 꽃잎에 입맞춤을 その花びらにくちづけを” 시리즈의 최신작. 물론 뉴 제네를 제외할 경우 그렇다는 얘기지만. 이미 지난 3월에 iOS와 안드로이드 버전으로 출시된 본 게임은, 제목으로 알 수 있듯 리사와 미야가 서로 처음 만났던 때를 회상하는 것이 주된 줄거리이며, 전연령판이기 때문에 섹스신은 없다. 이번에 PC와 Mac용으로 출시된 건 그 영문 버전. 다만 음성은 일본어로 수록되어 있다. 

이 둘은 물론 소노하나 시리즈에서 상당한 인기를 구가하는 귀여운 커플이고, 이 한 편만으로도 소노하나 시리즈의 매력을 충분히 맛볼 수 있다고 생각하기 때문에, 백합 장르를 좋아하는 사람이라면 구매해서 후회할 일은 당연히 전혀 없다고 생각. 거의 십 년 가까이 그 퀄을 증명해온 소노하나 시리즈에 대해 이제와서 뭔가 더 이것저것 코멘트를 갖다붙이는 것 자체가 부끄럽게 느껴진다. 

다만 음성은 일본어이며, 대사 텍스트는 영어로만 나오기 때문에, 일본어를 어느 정도 구사할 수 있는 사람이라면 PC판이 아닌 iOS/안드로이드판을 구매해서 온전한 일본어로 플레이하는 것이 옳을 것. 포팅은 깔끔하게 되어 있는 편으로, 시스템적인 면에선 다른 소노하나 시리즈의 PC판과 동일하다. 기본 해상도도 800*600 정도로 기존 시리즈와 동일한 듯? 웬만하면 좀 더 높은 해상도를 지원해줬으면 하는 아쉬움이 남기는 한다.

리사미야 커플, 그리고 소노하나 시리즈에 매력을 느꼈다면, 부디 기존에 나온 다른 작품들도 해보길 권한다. 개인적으로는 에리스와 시즈쿠 커플을 가장 좋아하는데, 아무래도 가장 인지도와 인기가 높은 건 레오마이 커플. 특히 레오 역의 성우인 안즈하나 씨의 경우 현재도 다른 소노하나 성우들과 함께 「玲緒っぽいらじお」 라는 웹 라디오를 진행하고 있으니 관심이 생긴다면 들어보시길.

총평(Overall) : (4 + 9 + 7) / 3 = ★★★★★★☆ 6.5 out of 10
* 게임 시리즈를 전통적으로 즐겨왔던 사람이라면 1~2점정도 더 쳐줄 수 있음.

18230896.review:
A short review for my favorite VN series

Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke o or A Kiss for the Petals is a pure yuri visual novel series by Fuguriya. This game in particular is a prequel to the untranslated story of the Miya x Risa VNs. In the theme of the previous VNs the characters and their interaction with each other are adorable. However, Unlike most of the VNs in the series this game is NOT R-18. The game has a stellar translation by MangaGamer as it is in the same vein that the fan translations are in both style and phrasing (without all the grammar and spelling errors). If you enjoy yuri and are looking for something “pure” and innocent then look no further than A Kiss for the Petals - Remembering How We Met. 

Port

Upscales to 1920 x 1080 fine. Full Screen in 4:3 on my 16:9 monitor looks best. Window mode’s size is reconfigurable.

Kiss for the Petals - Remembering How We Met is well, i have to say its a poor attempt to make a VN, don't get me wrong, it could be a decent quality VN, it has the potential to be one, they know how to introduce and developed their characters. It just have a few problems that i will explain in the next paragraphs.

First thing first, the only good thing that i can tell about this vn is the plot, its decent enough and actually serve its purpose, it tells how lovey dovey this two girls relationships is, and how when they first met they actually didn't have a lot in common, but they are drawn to each other by fate.. (i think). It also tells what Rita and Miya (The two main heroine) like about each others dispite being kinda different. The title didn't lie, its really "Remembering How We Met" and it was really sweet and innocent. My critic though, its really short ! It took me 3 hours to complete that. 3 hours !! I expected more out of it.

Now, i have to say since visual novel is actually only consist of plot, art visual, and audio. Visual is really important, the drawing in this vn is decent some of them are really cute, but there are only few of them. I seen about 8 background image and less than 15 characters sprites, i have to say that again, less than 15 !! The bad thing about that is, it makes the background image really boring because they use the same background in a lot of scene, and there's a couple of misunderstanding with their expression since in few of the scene, the characters are suppose to have a neutral expression or an annoyed expression and the character sprite that they used is a smilling sprite. There's also another problem, its not that big of a deal but i will say it either way, there's no character sprite for anybody else, except for Rita and Miya. It just strike as a lazyness for me, because they certainly could draw, but they just choose not to draw other background or other characters sprite.

The other problem that i have with this vn is the voice acting. The two main heroine has a good voice actor, i didn't have a lot of complain about that, they really give personality to Rita and Miya. Even though for some reason Rita is louder than Miya by a huge margin, which is really strange. My problem is the other minor characters voices, like girl A, girl B, teacher, or driver. Its really obvious that this vn only have possibly 4-5 other voice actress to voice the other characters and that is suppose to be fine, if they give the other characters a generic voice. But, they give a unique voice like the ear destroyer child voices to 2 different characters ! So, we have the same unique voice for 2 different characters. Its really confusing and bad. Again, it just seems lazy for me.

My conclusion is.. Visual, audio, plot is the main thing in a VN, unless you have a terrific plot and a beautiful visual. Having very few decent backgrounds that you use in a multiple scene, very confusing voice acting, only 3 hours in length, and also very few character sprites makes me cannot recommend this VN, even though the character development is actually kinda good.

18213444.review:
This is a review from a longtime fan of this long running series.

The Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo series of Visual novels is a purely yuri series, centering around the interactions between the all-female student body of the St. Michael's Girl's academy.

Most the installments of the series tend to be light on choices, and contain a fair amount of adult content. Each chapter of the original 11 (drawn by Peko and written by Jun) feature an individual couple from the series, with the 11th installment, Maidens of Michael, featuring all the couples from previous chapters.

This chapter, along with the overly chibified Hanahira are the exceptions to the rule of adult content as they are both all ages chapters. 

This (as far as I know) is the first chapter to receive an official western localization, and is a very light entry into the series, telling the story of Azumi Risa and Ayase Miya, a couple first introduced in Maidens of Michael and receiving their own chapter known as "Maidens of the Atelier" 

This is simply the story of how they met. It's as cute as any of the pervious chapters, and features no adult content. Definitely recommended for anyone who likes Yuri, despite it not having any choices to speak of.

Definitely work picking up if you have any history with the series (like me) or if you like Yuri at all.

I am realing excited about seeing a sono-hanabira game, even an all-ages one, up on steam; however, my excitment for this game is doubled by the fact that it features one of my favorite pairings from the series. It's great that steam is uploading more yuri titles and I can't wait to see wether or not they will upload more from this series. Okay enough fangirling/fanboying and on to the actual review. 

This is a visual novel and since it's a flashback based prequel, no choice options are given; therefore, while I, a self proclaimed bibliophile, enjoy this genre, I advise those looking for more interpersonal styled gameplay to rethink their purchase. Reading speed is subjective, but I managed to finish the game in about 1.4 hours; however, that might be too short for some people. The characters seem to simply be archtypes, but there is actually a deep layer of complexity underlying their personality traits. The dynamic between the characters is great and they contrast each other perfectly. 

The size of the fullscreen window could use some adjustmet, but otherwise there is nothing really wrong with the technical aspect of the game. 

In summary, I really enjoyed this game and recommend it as a great addition to one of the best yuri based series available.

A Kiss for the Petals is one of the classic yuri frenchise. It has an over 10+ visual novel games as well as an anime OVA. It's definitely a good start and perhaps the begining of more yuri related contents being released on Steam.

If you're a newbie when it comes to visual novels or even yuri as a genre, this game is a great start. 18205315.review:
As the fall season begins, Risa Azumi reminisces about how she and her now girlfriend, Miyu Ayase, first met, hence the title. It's the first visual novel in the nearly decade long Sonohana franchise to be officially released in the west, and the first non-spin-off entry to be non-H.

The story is that, when Risa and Miyu first met, Miyu, the newly transfered student, would quickly start to skip classes very frequently which irks Risa, the newly chosen class representative, particularly because the teacher asked her to help Miyu get adjusted to the school. What follows is a series of events which leads them to develop feelings for each other.

While it's a sequel-prequel to three other entries in the Sonohana series, it is somewhat newbie friendly due to the story concerning how they first met, even though there is a noticable gap between the flashback and the present day. On the other hand, it doesn't give newbies any indication how pornographic the series can get, even though the not so subtle raunchy parts of the dialogue from the beginning and the end is a clear nod to the fact that this series is an eroge series first and foremost. For those who aren't into eroges, Remembering How We Met is still good as a stand alone story, although some small details go nowhere without the context of the other installments.

Clocking in at approximately 3 hours with auto enabled at a brisk reading speed, Remembering How We Met is a short, fully voice acted kinetic (linear, with no branches whatsoever) visual novel with no replay value aside from picking up some details in the dialogue you might've missed the first time around. Aside from the main story, there are a couple extras; a CG gallery, BGM player, and a set named Memories, which is essentially the entire visual novel cut up into multiple chapters, which is good for people who didn't make their own bookmarks (although the game will return you back to the Memories tab once you reach the end of that section of the story). The UI is pretty standard for a visual novel, and everything runs pretty smoothly, although the text will occassionally hiccup when set to auto as it will fail to roll out and most of it will pop up at once instead (thankfully, those hiccups don't affect the audio as well). At $8, it's pretty reasonable if you compare it to the cost/hour of anime (which, given that it's a kinetic visual novel, is a fair comparision) and it's a must buy for any yuri fans.

18196659.review:
Are you searching for meaning in life? Tired of pondering the intricacies of the greater universe unfathomable?

"A Kiss For The Petals" or Sono Hanabira is the answer. It is the shining beacon of respite in a world without enough yuri. When you may have troubled yourself as to life's mundane purpose, you smile, knowing that you must trouble yourself no longer, for it is done, and Sono Hanabira is on Steam.

Notes:

This was originally a mobile/iPhone supplementary game in the Sono Hanabira series, and this is clearly an experimental English license. Fans will be supporting this release wildly for further localizations, and for newcomers, it may seem a bit overblown. This is not a long visual novel, nor is it entirely representative of Sono Hanabira as a whole. With that said...

"What's with 'Sono Hanabira?'"

For long-time fans of the series, this is the seventeenth game, and one of two that are 'all-ages' (the other being Hanahira, for those of you interested in continuing your adventure into Sono Hanabira while staying within the 'all-ages space). Sono Hanabira started as a doujin nukige (doujin: amateur work by a small group of individuals; nukige: visual novel where the plot is only around to allow for 'plot') that was very well received for its tone, atmosphere, and high-quality character designs. 

"Finally, yuri done right!"
 
A core cast of couples was developed, and multiple releases furthered the story between each of them. The success was too much to ignore, and after ten doujin releases, the company 'Yurin Yurin' was founded and it became a professional endeavour. "St. Michael's Girl's School - Maidens of Michael" was released as a full length visual novel that connected, expanded, and meaningfully explored the characters in a way that previous entries didn't have room for. A shorter sequel was released, focusing on the new couple Risa and Miya (the ones featured in this game!), as were wholly original ventures (such as ones focusing on a post-high school Nursing School) and even a "New Generations" series re-boot with an entirely new cast, as 'Yurin Yurin' was replaced as developers by 'St. Michael's Girl's Academy' (again, a company founded entirely for this venture). 

At this point, fans are dying to play Sono Hanabira in its wholly professional and full length visual novel glory, but, it has far outpaced the fan translators and official English licensing and releases are wanted. So, with everything we've got, fans support Sono Hanabira in its fullest with this game! With enough support, the more lengthy games will be licensed, and the age of yuri can be heralded!

18193969.review:
In A Kiss for Petals - Remembering How We Met, what seems at first to be a regular yuri VN in actuality has the two protagonists Risa and Miya present an interesting take on the position of Cartesian Duality, in contrast to the earlier Aristotelian rejection of Forms. This Visual Novel functions as in essence a prequel exploring the backstories of the two primary characters, a juncture where they were unfamiliar with one another. This unaccustomed disposition the two take establishes the analogue to Cartesian Duality, as outlined in the Meditations of Descartes.

In this past instance where the two principal characters are recondite to each other, the comparison is established as a degree of separation is seen between the two. Just as they are separate, two very different characters with Miya the intellect as the mind and Risa the epicurean as the body, so too then are the mind and body, a distinction between the the bodily substance, res extensa and the thinking immaterial yet definite substance, res cogitans. 

However, as the two character become closer, there is a dramatic shift to a more Spinozan philosophy as outlined in Ethics. Just as Spinoza follows Descartes, so too is this represented by the growing attraction between the two characters, leading to their relationship. The couple is thus as a single thing, but with differing properties. Countering Descartes, the whole is as such and we can not draw a distinction between in terms of interaction. For Spinoza, there is no thinking substance and no extended substance, only the one substance, represented as the couple. 

“We say that they all form one body or individual, which is distinguished from the rest by this union of the bodies.”
-Baruch Spinoza

18193186.review:
A Kiss For The Petals franchise, Remembering How We Met is a great chapter for those who are new to the series as it tells the brand new story of Risa and Miya romance while looking back on the history of their time in St. Michael Girl's School. A long look back at Risa and Miya relationship, telling the tale of how they first met and came to be lovers it follows Risa and Miya’s storyline from Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke o - Michael no Otome-tachi (correct me if i am wrong)

[h1]Brief overview of the story[/h1]
The story starts off with Risa suddenly feeling nostalgia. It was this very uniform she was wearing on her first day at St. Michael’s. The day she met her future girlfriend Miya.
As Risa starts to look back this will be a story that shows Risa and Miya’s first encounter, where they were initially antagonistic toward each other as both are smart in different ways.
Risa is studious and works hard for her achievements while Miya seeks the freedom to pursue her own interests, bcause of her innate intelligence making class a bore for her, as it all started with Risa just trying to get Miya to come to class... 
How did love manage to blossom between them? Find out as they recount the tale in a sweet loving and charming fashion.

[h1]Audio and Visual elements[/h1]
[b]Visual Elements[/b] - The CGs of this game are very pleasant to look at and the art style is very "charming" with the use of bright colors to depict the mood and environment.

[b]Audio Elements[/b] - The music sets the mood for every situation, depicting playfulness, happiness and many more. While dialogue and voice acting are both well done. Ending credit music are pleasing to listen to.
[b]However[/b] there is one problem which i found is that the "applause" sound does not fit into the visual novel at all in. Eg. The scene where Miya presented her plans for the tea party and it was perfect, the applause at that scene does not fit in at all.

[h1]In Conclusion[/h1]
For those who are new to the franchise, this series is a must follow for every fan of yuri. As it focuses on relationships between two girls who fall in love with each other, A Kiss For The Petals stays true to the romance between two women. Though adult scenes are plentiful, this series is charming, and have natural development of relationships as the heroines go on dates, try to steal moments alone to express their love, and bond with each other in a very tender fashion.

To sum up i would recommend this visual novel to anyone who are fans of this genre, Yuri. This visual novel will last 3 - 4 hours.

[i]A note - This particular Sonohana title, A Kiss for the Petals - Remembering How We Met, is strictly an all-ages game. An adult version of this game does not exist. MangaGamer, as the publisher, did not remove, alter, or censor content for the Steam release.[/i]

39419779.review:
Review originally posted [url=https://www.backlog-assassins.net/posts/obnnmab/]here[/url].

8/10

This is an adorable kinetic novel. Giselle told me this is part of a series - and one of the very few safe for work ones - and it’s about how two characters from the series met and how their relationship started.

I know the original series is wlw written by and for adult men but this game is sweetly written enough I can just grab it with my gay little hands and make it mine because I feel it fills a niche that I sorely needed filled - cute, sweet, sappy, romantic stories about girls loving girls in which there’s no heartache or drama. It’s wish-fulfillment of the highest degree, and I don’t get to see that very often. The story opens up with them in a happy relationship, you see how that happens, the end.

It’s short, it’s sweet, it is what it needs to be. The writing is nice - no glaring errors. The art is cute. If Fata Morgana was a eighty-five course meal in a sprawling gothic estate that lasts two weeks, A Kiss for the Petals is a donut - but a really nice donut given to you by your loving girlfriend and you both hold hands while you eat it. I got to read this without flinching and my heart leapt when the VN opened with ‘… and this is the second year at school with my girlfriend’ and my god does that count for something. That counts for something.

39387361.review:
Una de las novelas de la serie de novelas yuri Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo. "Remembering How We Met" se trata de una kinetic novel, es decir, un tipo de novela visual donde los jugadores / lectores no toman decisiones y por tanto el contenido es un único desarrollo de la historia posible. Aclarado esto añadir:

-La historia me pareció encantadora, agradable y sencilla con un nivel de inglés no muy exigente.
-El desarrollo de los personajes en la historia es muy bueno, transmiten unos sentimientos que fácilmente nos harán encariñarnos con ellas.
-El arte visual también es muy bueno fiel al estilo de la serie, destacaría las expresiones faciales y los adorables momentos chibi.
-La música es sencilla pero a mi no me cansó en ningún momento, creo que acompaña muy bien lo que nos transmite cada escena.
-Lo malo es que es algo corta y ahí cada uno deberá valorar si le compensa pagar lo que cuesta por estos contenidos.

Si te gusta la lectura, el yuri romántico sin escenas para adultos y si el precio no es un impedimento la recomiendo al 100%.
